intro: Erodium cicutarium subsp. romanum, commonly known as "dwarf redstem," is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features small, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces tiny, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom from spring to early summer. Its seeds are enclosed in a distinctive, puffy, hairy capsule that aids in wind dispersal. This species is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in cultivated fields.
